summary: Five vulnerabilities detected in the go.temporal.io/server dependency (version v1.17.5), including three high-severity CVEs affecting Apache Thrift and Uber Tally libraries. The vulnerabilities relate to SASL negotiation bypass, endless loops in Thrift processing, and metrics buffering issues.
userImpact: Users are exposed to multiple high-severity security vulnerabilities in transitive dependencies that could allow integrity compromise and denial of service attacks.
rootCause: Outdated versions of Apache Thrift (v0.0.0-20161221203622) and Uber Tally (v4.1.2) in the dependency tree contain known security vulnerabilities without available fixes in those specific versions.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or is no longer part of the Mend inventory.
keyQuote: Found in HEAD commit: 63b662559cd583d424ccbd121f96a1194e1fa2eb - detected in multiple dependencies: go.temporal.io/server-v1.17.5
